item.title: Ukraine war: Zelensky plea as Russians seek Mariupol endgame
item.description: The Ukrainian president appeals for fresh UN help as Russians reportedly enter the city's last holdout.

item.title: Disabled children 'dumped' in Ukrainian institutions
item.description: Thousands of disabled Ukrainian children reportedly left in institutions that can’t care for them.

item.title: Ukraine war: EU plans Russian oil ban and war crimes sanctions
item.description: The measures are some of the toughest yet but Hungary has rejected them as unacceptable.

item.title: Anger outside Mississippi's last abortion clinic
item.description: Activists from both sides of the debate say they will fight on whatever the US Supreme Court rules.

item.title: Ukraine war: Russia denies it plans to declare war on 9 May
item.description: The Kremlin has so far only referred to the war in Ukraine as a "special military operation".

item.title: Otoniel: Colombia drug kingpin extradited to US
item.description: Dairo Antonio Úsuga, better known as Otoniel, was captured in October, ending a seven-year manhunt.

item.title: Amber Heard says Johnny Depp struck her when on drugs
item.description: Taking the stand, Amber Heard alleges a pattern of violence from the Pirates of the Caribbean star.

item.title: US makes biggest interest rate rise in 22 years
item.description: The Federal Reserve is under pressure as the US grapples with its worst inflation in four decades.

item.title: Ahmadreza Djalali: Sweden alarmed by Iran's reported plan to execute doctor
item.description: A semi-official news agency says dual national Ahmadreza Djalali will be put to death this month.

item.title: Russia on agenda as British and Japanese PMs meet
item.description: Boris Johnson and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida are expected to agree a defensive partnership.

item.title: Kenya's Talai clan petitions Prince William over land eviction
item.description: The Talai clan say they were evicted from their land for tea plantations, some still owned by UK firms.

item.title: Bill Gates on Elon Musk feud and Jeffrey Epstein meetings
item.description: The Microsoft tycoon talks to the BBC about divorce, conspiracy theories and Elon Musk.

item.title: Dolly Parton, Eminem and Duran Duran join Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: The star had asked not to be included, but will be still inducted alongside Eminem and Duran Duran.

item.title: Ismael Borrero: Cuba's Olympic wrestling champion defects
item.description: The wrestling champion is the latest Cuban athlete to abscond while competing abroad.

item.title: Mali nonuplets in perfect health on first birthday - father
item.description: The nine Malian babies hold the world record for the most children delivered in a single birth to survive.

item.title: Al-Shabab attack on African Union forces in Somalia: What we know
item.description: Islamist militants have carried out what may be their most deadly attacks on the African Union mission.

item.title: 'There's power in names': Antigua unearths lost ancestors
item.description: A landmark genealogy project is unearthing the names of enslaved people whose stories were erased.

item.title: Myanmar civil war: ‘I saw my son’s body on Facebook’
item.description: After the Myanmar military entered his village, Joseph fled into the jungle but his 13-year-old was killed.

item.title: Roe v Wade: US women divided on leaked abortion ruling
item.description: Overturning the right to an abortion would be a major win for some. For others, a devastating loss.

item.title: How Covid-scarred Shanghai will finally exit lockdown
item.description: A mass clean-up is sweeping through Shanghai, with the city's gradual reopening expected to follow.

item.title: Sri Lanka: The divisions behind the country's united protests
item.description: Can protests sparked by the economic crisis bridge Sri Lanka's religious and ethnic divides?

item.title: Ukraine invasion and Yemen conflict: The couple from Kerala who survived both
item.description: While Akhil Reghu was being held captive by rebels in Yemen, his wife was trapped by war in Ukraine.

item.title: Oil prices have soared. Why won't Opec bring them down?
item.description: Oil prices are at an eight-year high, so why won't oil exporting countries bring them down?

item.title: Durban floods survivors: 'I thought the world was ending'
item.description: Moeketsi Manake and his family talk about losing everything, including their house, in the Durban floods.

item.title: Hungary will veto EU oil ban proposal - minister
item.description: Zoltán Kovács says the proposal is against the country's interests and would ruin the Hungarian economy.

item.title: Abortion ruling: Overturning Roe v Wade an assault on freedom - Harris
item.description: The US vice president reacts angrily to abortion rights news saying it would deny women freedom.

item.title: Maradona shirt: Why the 1986 World Cup kit is so special
item.description: Bidding for the shirt Diego Maradona wore scoring the "Hand of God" goal has already reached £4m.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… Could Ukraine’s war spread to Moldova?
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why there is concern Moldova could be drawn into war, like its neighbour Ukraine.
